place.name: SPARSHOLT
place.gazetteerText: SPARSHOLT, a parish, with a village, in Winchester district, Hants; 2¾ miles WNW of Winchester r. station. It has a post-office under Winchester. Acres, 3,542. Real property, £3,301. Pop., 395. Houses, 84. The property is divided among a few. Some Roman remains have been found. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £300.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good; and there is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
